*• Professional .Advancement
This activity will be concerned with the determination and advance¬
ment of professional standards. Through it, educational institutions will
cooperatively identify and support standards in the training of educational
broadcasting personnel, the training of technicians, the organization of in¬
structional materials, basic values of production, and the basic processes of
utilization.
Successful integration of electronic communications and education
depends on the development of a core of professional personnel with the philo¬
sophical concepts and practical understanding adequate to that process. There
is now no agency which identifies, stimulates, encourages, and recognizes
standards of professional excellence in tits area,
The standards set will serve further to stimulate and interest edu¬
cational personnel generally, and prospective contributors to this field, in
becoming active participants in the over-ell effort to advance education through
the intelligent use of educational technology. To this end, it will, in cooperation
with institutions of higher education, develop courses of study in the media and
their responsible uses.
Professional excellence will be encouraged at all levels of educa¬
tional broadcasting. Provision will be made for recognition of individuals,
educational institutions, and industrial organizations who have exemplified,
maintained and supported the adopted standards.
Efforts will be made to encourage and initiate publication of articles
and reports devoted to the identification and demonstration of the standards,
B. Educational Brgadcaattng and Civic Education
Today we are increasingly aware of the significance of the communica¬
tions media for the survival and growth of the American society.
Since our ideology emphasizes the primacy of the people, it is important
that civic education be carried on across a wide base of the population; hence,
the mess media, of which television is the most powerful, has an Important
responsibility end opportunity in this respect.
